title: How to Toggle WiFi On and Off with a Keyboard Shortcut on Mac

steps.title: Open Terminal.
steps.content: Open Terminal. Copy paste this in: networksetup -listnetworkserviceorder .

steps.title: Remember the number that shows the WiFi.
steps.content: Remember the number that shows the WiFi. Then, you can close Terminal and open Automator.

steps.title: Choose a type for your document.
steps.content: Choose a type for your document. Click on Quick Action and Choose .

steps.title: Search for run shell script in the search bar on the left.
steps.content: Search for run shell script in the search bar on the left. Double click on it.

steps.title: Make sure the top section is correct on the right:
steps.content: Make sure the top section is correct on the right: Workflow receives no input in any application .

steps.title: Copy and paste the following script into the section of “Run Shell Script,” substituting “X” with any number that you found the WiFi port to be earlier.
steps.content: Copy and paste the following script into the section of “Run Shell Script,” substituting “X” with any number that you found the WiFi port to be earlier. The script is: networksetup -getairportpower enX | grep "On" && networksetup -setairportpower enX off || networksetup -setairportpower enX on.

steps.title: Click on Run in the top right corner.
steps.content: Click on Run in the top right corner. See if your WiFi turns off. You might need to wait a few seconds. If it works, click on the X and save the action, and name it something obvious like “WiFi Toggle.” Then, proceed to the next section.

steps.title: Open System Preferences > Keyboard.
steps.content: Open System Preferences > Keyboard . At the top, click on Shortcuts .

steps.title: Click on Services.
steps.content: Click on Services . Scroll to the very bottom until you find the action that you just created.

steps.title: Click on the None to the right of the name.
steps.content: Click on the None to the right of the name. Then, click on Add Shortcut .

steps.title: Type in your shortcut.
steps.content: Type in your shortcut. You might use Ctrl + ⌥ Opt + ⌘ Cmd + W . Control Option Command W). Make sure the shortcut is not a common shortcut.

steps.title: Test your shortcut.
steps.content: Test your shortcut. It should work!
